snippet: Gov. Jay Nixon vetoed a measure that would have made Missouri the 26th so-called right-to-work state, and it is uncertain whether proponents will be able to muster enough support in the Republican-led Legislature to override the veto.
abstract: Gov Jay Nixon vetoes measure that would have made Missouri 26th so-called right-to-work-state; remains unclear whether legislature will be able to muster votes to override veto.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jay Nixon vetoed a measure that would have made Missouri the 26th so-called right-to-work state, and it is uncertain whether proponents will be able to muster enough support in the Republican-led Legislature to override the veto.

headline.main: Missouri: Bill to Curb Unions Is Vetoed
headline.print_headline: Missouri: Bill to Curb Unions Is Vetoed
